name: flabbiness
content:
flabbiness noun [U]
(FAT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being soft and fat: This is a good exercise for toning upper arms to avoid flabbiness. There was a little flabbiness in his lower belly.
More examplesFewer examplesThey needed exercise to become athletic and lose the flabbiness of age. "Flabbiness in Lycra is awful, especially with pale legs," said Emmison.areas of the body that are prone to flabbiness

flabbiness noun [U]
(WEAK)
the quality of being weak and without force, or using too much of something: He saw a lot of flabbiness in the way the company was being managed. moral/political flabbiness See
flabby
More examplesFewer examplesIn its final moments, the film lapses into flabbiness.He criticised the public sector for its outrageous flabbiness and waste.There is a flabbiness to much of the author's thought.
